meanings.definition: To cut or tear off the limbs of (a person or animal)
meanings.sent1: The butcher dismembered the chicken for cooking.
meanings.sent2: The forensic team found evidence that the victim was dismembered.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie villain dismembered his victims with a chainsaw.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to dismember the once peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon carefully dismembered the tumor from the patient's body.

meanings.definition: To divide into parts or pieces
meanings.sent1: The puzzle can be dismembered into smaller sections for easier solving.
meanings.sent2: The organization decided to dismember the project into manageable tasks.
meanings.sent3: The toddler managed to dismember the tower of blocks with a single push.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting seemed to dismember reality into fragments.
meanings.sent5: The explosion threatened to dismember the building into rubble.
